txt.en: 'Come, slaves. Deal with these worms!'
'You defeated the mighty Barz? Tread carefully, Zurm has no doubt heard and will be even more dangerous!'
'We need rest. We are tired...many have died....'
'What is this foolishness? None can withstand Zurm!'
'The slave-masters say you refuse to work!'
'Rest? REST? I'll give you a rest!'
'Aye, we'll deal with them first!'
'Let us see how you fare against one of my trolls!'
'Anyone else need a rest?'
'Then back to work!'
'Thank you, little ones. I would have perished.'
'We did more than half the work...the giant is ours!'
'But why did you save me when all the other little ones wished me dead?'
'Maybe the old tales are true then, and the Ever-seer is wrong.'
'The little ones have two camps with strong leaders. I have heard the names Barz and Zurm. They are big and strong for their kind, yet refuse to fight!'
'I cannot leave until they are defeated. They will soon dig into our home! Go and fight them, then we may talk again!'
'You dare challenge the might of Barz?'
'Zurm will not be pleased.'
'Barz and his petty rabble will not take the credit for this!'
'You keep the other slaves working, or Zurm will have your head!'
'My trolls will deal with you!'
'Your lot only confused him...it was my slaves what finally brought him down.'
'You have defeated Zurm? You are mighty for your tiny size! Barz still lives and will be even more powerful now that he alone rules the mines.'
'Stealing our glory? We will see what Barz has to say about it!'
'So you were able to defeat Barz and Zurm! I did not expect so much from ones so small.'
'Fools! Aid your master...destroy them!'
'Maybe you are the ones the old tales tell about. Come with me, and we shall see.'
'Quickly! Destroy them! Barz commands it!'
'Intruders! Get them!'
'Go quickly! I will hold off their assaults. You must defeat Barz and Zurm!'
'He is ours! We saw him first!'
Hi!
'Slaves, destroy these intruders, or you will feel my lash!'
'Keep a watch for any of Zurm's trickery. We have orders from Barz to gain control of the mines at all cost.'
'Work harder! Barz wants twice as much ore as Zurm's last haul!'
